title: CWG 2022, Day 6 blog: Tulika wins judo silver; brilliant bronze in squash, athletics, weightlifting
content:
2.51 am: A disappointing end but that was another impressive day for India with multiple medals being won and assured. Thatâ€™s it from us for now, do join us tomorrow for the live coverage.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #BoxingWhat a fight that, still processing! Ashish, who was onto something at the #B2022 and wanted to fulfil dreams of his late father and a CWG medal would've been a step in that direction. Still worth reading about his story: https://t.co/Q03SnYNUmGâ€” Samreen (@SamreenRazz) August 3, 2022



    #CWG2022 #B2022 #Boxing: Yep, timely reminder to not get invested in a boxing bout. How one judge found that to be 30-27 in favour of the English boxer, I can't understand. Anyway an absolutely amazing fight & atmosphere & massive credit to Ashish ğŸ‘ğŸ½https://t.co/kYwAveNvus pic.twitter.com/csD2KhRyfnâ€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 3, 2022

    Boxing, menâ€™s 80kg QF: WHAT A FIGHT! One for the ages.   Ashish gives it his all but Bowen takes it with a split decision 4:1. End of a brilliant campaign for the Indian who didnâ€™t go down without a fight.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, menâ€™s 80kg QF: That this is an intense bout is an understatement! Three judges level in R2. And it will boil down to the final round. Ashish has to find a way. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    ğŸ˜ƒ All smiles!What a moment for @OlympicsKe & @Ferdiomanyala in the Men's 100m Final!#CommonwealthGames #B2022 pic.twitter.com/OlxCNEBpofâ€” Commonwealth Sport (@thecgf) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, menâ€™s 80kg QF: The cleaner shots came from Bowen and Ashish has not quite gotten the attacking shots first but itâ€™s 3:2 in his favour in R1. To make matters worse for Ashish, thereâ€™s insane crowd support for the home lad.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    Of course, Elaine Thompson-Herah takes the womenâ€™s 100m gold.#CWG2022 #Athletics pic.twitter.com/YtUDKY3Er1â€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing: In todayâ€™s last bout including an Indian, Ashish Kumar will face Englandâ€™s Aaron Bowen, a British National Champion several times. The 80kg QF promises to be an interesting (and probably, tricky) one.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Gold for Kenyaâ€™s Ferdinand Omanyala in the menâ€™s 100m race. Sri Lankaâ€™s Yupun Abeykoon takes a memorable bronze.#CWG2022 #Athletics pic.twitter.com/ik7Htslrk7â€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022

    Athletics, womenâ€™s shot put: A little while earlier, Manpreet Kaur finished 12th with three throws of 15.57, 15.56, 15.59. It wasnâ€™t enough to make the cut for top 8 and have all six attempts.

    #CWG2022 #B2022India's first ever #Athletics High Jump medal in CWG history. ğŸ¥‰@TejaswinShankar ğŸ‘ğŸ½ğŸ“¸ Sony LIVhttps://t.co/n8yjr7q7O6 pic.twitter.com/hiBVFGdEUpâ€” The Field (@thefield_in) August 3, 2022



    A week back Tejaswin Shankar was practising in front of 3 dogs at JLN Stadium, after not being named to the CWG squad despite meeting the AFI QF standard. Included at the last minute after taking the fed to court, today in front of 30000, he wins a high jump bronze in Birmingham. pic.twitter.com/1YDiEsvjE3â€” jonathan selvaraj (@jon_selvaraj) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Vinayakk: Tejaswin Shankar, what a story. What a journey. Proof that often truth is stranger than fiction. No one knew whether he was going to take part in the Games until a few days before. Court cases, CGF denials, late changes... he made it. And now he is the first ever Indian high jumper to win a CWG medal.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket: India are into the semifinals. Was never in doubt after the opening spell by Renuka Thakur. What a CWG she has had. Here are the scores:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: India win by 100 runs! A comprehensive win for Harmanpreet Kaur and they are through to the semifinal. Asked to bat first in the Group A match, India made 162/4 thanks to Shafali Verma (43 off 26), Jemimah Rodrigues (56* off 46) and Deepti Sharma (34* off 28). They then restricted Barbados to 62/8 in 20 overs, with new-ball bowler Renuka Singh Thakur picking a brilliant 4/10.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 Tejaswin Shankar: Late addition to the Birmingham Indian squad, first athlete to win a track & field medal at the Games.Quite the rollercoaster story.https://t.co/S2CWNUOKzS pic.twitter.com/wl8mLtRbw7â€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Itâ€™s a bronze medal forTejaswin Shankar! What a story. He made it to the CWG squad late, but wins Indiaâ€™s first track & field medal at the 2022 Birmingham Games.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: BRONZE! Tejaswin Shankarâ€™s medal is confirmed thanks to clean slate earlier in the competition. He skips the third 2.25m attempt and goes for a bigger height at 2.28 but misses that (one attempt only). But that confirms a superb medal for the India.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Tejaswin Shankar wins bronze medal in menâ€™s high jump! ğŸ‘#CWG2022 #Athletics pic.twitter.com/TQiyipwHyBâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



    #CWG2022 #B2022#Athletics Men's High Jump finalThere we go! Tejaswin Shankar's medal confirmed! BRILLIANT. ğŸ‘ğŸ½https://t.co/S2CWNUOKzS pic.twitter.com/JvFooCR9ZZâ€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Clean card till now. But now two misses at 2.25m. Only two men have cleared that height so far. Thomas and Clarke-Khan also in last-chance territory.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 70kg QF: A come from behind win from Eccles and itâ€™s a HUGE upset for Lovlina! Couldnâ€™t regain the momentum after R2, kept getting warned for holding and Eccles pounced at that with all 5 judges in her favour. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    Major upset as Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Lovlina Borgohain loses to Rosie Eccles of Wales in the womenâ€™s 70kg quarterfinals.#CWG2022 #Boxing pic.twitter.com/aC0bd8NklOâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Tejaswin Shankar is now in last-chance territory all of a sudden. Kerr & Starc have done it at 2.25m and the Indian has missed two attempts.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Meanwhile, Harman doing Harman things. Another spectacular catch by the India captain.#CWG2022 #INDvBAR pic.twitter.com/XYc6iMFcc4â€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 70kg QF: A point disadvantage for Lovlina for holding held her back for the rest of the round. But itâ€™s 3:2 judges in favour of the Indian in R2. Needs to regain her momentum.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Into the top 5 is Tejaswin Shankar. In joint top place at the moment with Hamish Kerr. Three more have cleared 2.22, including defending champ Starc.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 70kg QF: The reach advantage for Lovlina means that she has been able to land far more shots than Eccles. R1 with judges 4:1 in favour of the Indian.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: India in complete control here.   Sneh Rana removed Kyshona Knight and the task is getting close to impossible for Barbados.   BAR: 39/5 (11) IND: 162/4 (20)
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Samreen Razzaqui: After an impressive opening bout, Lovlina Borgohain would be hoping to keep adding to Indiaâ€™s tally of medals by the boxers. In action now in the womenâ€™s 70kg QF vs Rosie Eccles of Wales.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: 2.22m done first time too. Tejaswin Shankar continues to jump with good momentum. Another first-time clearance for the Indian! Only New Zealandâ€™s Hamish Kerr apart from the Indian has a clean card so far. Starc gaining some form now, best jump of the night so far for him. 2.22m cleared in two attempts.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Dilip Unnikrishnan: Gurdeep Singh wins bronze with a total of 390kg! Muhammad Butt takes gold with a Games record total of 405kg with David Liti taking silver with a total of 394kg.  India finish on top of the medal standings with three gold, three silver and four bronze medals, one more than what they won in Gold Coast four years ago.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 70kg QF: After an impressive opening bout, Lovlina Borgohain would be hoping to keep adding to Indiaâ€™s tally of medals by the boxers. In action shortly in the womenâ€™s 70kg QF vs Rosie Eccles of Wales. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Tejaswin Shankar among four athletes to have a clean card with 2.19m. Good stuff from the Indian so far. Seven athletes have cleared the height overall. Defending champion Brandon Starc JUST ABOUT stays alive, clearing 2.19 with his third attempt. The bar is at 2.22m now.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: BRONZE! Gurdeep Singh wins Indiaâ€™s 10th medal at the 2022 Birmingham Commonwealth Games!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022#CricketT20ğŸ #INDvBARWhat a tournament Renuka Singh Thakur has had! 4/181/204/10https://t.co/7xe5VOdsz5 pic.twitter.com/u4HCBG0CA7â€” The Field (@thefield_in) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Four overs, 10 runs, four wickets. What a spell from Renuka Singh Thakur!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Image credit: Twitter @BCCIWomen

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Gurdeep Singh smashes a 223kg final lift to finish with 390kg. Will that be enough to snatch silver from David Liti? Not today. Liti lifts 224kg to move to 394kg.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    Itâ€™s Renuka Singh Thakurâ€™s world.#CWG2022 #INDvBAR pic.twitter.com/oxhOgKOflTâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: Renuka Singh Thakur! Wow! She has run through West Indiesâ€™ top order with two more wickets in one over. Kycia Knight and Aaliyah Alleyne are back in the hut and WI have been reduced to 19/4 in 5 overs, chasing 163.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Gurdeep Singh has been assured of a medal! With Suamili Nanai failing with his final lift, Singh has confirmed bronze for himself. Will come out for a final 220g lift.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Gurdeep raises his weights by 8kg to 215kg. Takes his time to jerk the weight up and lifts it. However, the jury flags the lift as Gurdeepâ€™s right elbow had bent.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    #CWG2022 #B2022#CricketT20 #INDvBARSo Renuka Singh Thakur's wicket list includes: HealyLanningMooneyMcGrath DottinMatthewsThat is quite the collectionhttps://t.co/S2CWNUOKzS pic.twitter.com/yDnCBZmapZâ€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Gurdeep Singh had listed 210kg for his first c&j lift but has brought it down to 207kg. Effortlessly completes the lift and takes a big step towards ensuring a podium finish.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: India are off to a dream start with the ball thanks to Renuka Singh! She has delivered again with the new ball and dismissed the dangerous pair of Deandra Dottin and skipper Hayley Matthews. Dottin was clean bowled and Matthews is caught at mid-on. West Indies are 10/2 after 2.2 overs, chasing 163.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Tejaswin Shankar clears 2.15m also on the first attempt. He is pleased, so he should be. Brandon Starc also clears the height but needed a 2nd attempt. Could come into play later on.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    

    Renuka Singh does it again. Deandra Dottin gone for a duck.#CWG2022 #INDvBAR pic.twitter.com/3qHJdao2stâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



    #CWG2022 #B2022Tuilka Maan manages to bring out little bit of a smile on the podium with her judo silver medal. Either side of this pose though, still seemed pretty disappointed at missing out on gold.https://t.co/S2CWNUOKzS pic.twitter.com/64lyKam5ebâ€” Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 3, 2022



    

    Deepti Sharma and Jemimah Rodrigues are a pretty decent T20 batting pair, it seems! #SLvIND #B2022 #TheYoungUns #RunaHardAndDiveâ€” Ananya Upendran (@a_upendran11) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: India finish with 162/4. Jemimah Rodrigues remains unbeaten on 56 off 46 and hits the last ball of the innings for four. Deepti Sharma remains not out on 34 off 28. The duo added an unbeaten partnership of 70 runs for the fifth wicket. India lost Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur early but Shafali Verma (43 off 26), Jemimah and Deepti have ensured they have a competitive total to defend in this must-win game.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Crucial half-century by Jemimah Rodrigues. Wasnâ€™t her most fluent but much-needed runs for India.#CWG2022 #INDvBAR pic.twitter.com/Ot5H2Pw5RVâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Tejaswin Shankar has cleared 2.10m in his first attempt. Among a group of athletes who have done so including a certain Brandon Starc.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Pakistanâ€™s Muhammad Butt is in the lead with a successful lift of 175kg. David Liti is 2nd with a best of 170kg while Gurdeep Singh is tied 3rd with Gordon Shaw at 167kg.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Gurdeep raises the weights to 173kg for his third and final attempt. The first failed lift means he has no room for error. Unsuccessful. Ends snatch third with a best of 167kg.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Probably the most eagerly awaited event for me of these CWGs. Come on TJ...let's get a medal!â€” Vaibhav Manocha (@BeingMinchu) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, menâ€™s high jump final: Time for the menâ€™s high jump final and Indiaâ€™s Tejaswin Shankar is in action here. He has been through one rollercoaster of a build-up. Can he make it a sweet ending? Updates to follow.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Samreen Razzaqui: After the end of the bout, the first thing Nikhat Zareen did was hug her coaches but then looked into the camera and conveyed a wish to her mother Parveena Sultana whose birthday was yesterday. â€œHappy birthday Ammi, love you. May God keep you happy,â€ she said. Before this bout, she wished her mother on instagram and said that she would soon bring her a gift when sheâ€™s back. The gift, of course, she is hoping would be a gold. The World Champion is looking good to get the 2022 hat-trick.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Congratulations @SauravGhosal !! Nobody deserves this more than you ! You continue to inspire me and next generation of athletes around the ğŸŒ!â€” Shlok Ramchandran (@shlokh95) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Weightlifting, menâ€™s 109+kg final: Dilip Unnikrishnan â€“ Gurdeep Singh fails to lift 167kg with his first lift. Looks at his left arm in disbelief and will have to come back for a second attempt. Gurdeep gets the job done at the second time of asking! Super easy lift making the failed first lift look like an anomaly.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Judo, womenâ€™s +78 kg final: Vinayakkâ€“ Scotlandâ€™s Sarah ADLINGTON is a veteran and the top seed who has won a title before. Tulika MAAN was here for the first time. And she gave it a good go. Countered the Scotâ€™s attack and got a Waza-ari early but Adlington responded with a Ippon soon after to win the CWG gold again. Tulika looked devastated at the end. But it is a memorable silver for the 2nd seed.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 50kg QF: Samreen Razzaqui â€“ And Nikhat Zareen assures the medal! Defeats Helen Jones by a 5:0 UD in the QFs. The Welsh upped her game in the end but the Indian had done enough to seal the deal.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    

    Medal assured for Nikhat Zareen. Dominance again by the world champion in the quarters.#CWG2022 #Boxing pic.twitter.com/TAaIkIR7mzâ€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



    #CWG2022 #B2022ğŸ¥ˆ Tuilka Maan #Judo ğŸ¥‹  The Indian, seeded secodn, finishes 2nd in Women +78 kg. India's third judo medal.ğŸ“¸ Sony LIV https://t.co/7xe5VOdsz5 pic.twitter.com/DOP5kHvq7Kâ€” The Field (@thefield_in) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 50kg QF: Much better from Jones in R2 but itâ€™s not enough to prevent all five judges from voting in favour of Nikhat. Dominant!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 50kg QF: Sharp, precise work from Nikhat, as one expects of her. All 5 judges in favour. Lands some great punches, several times. Surprised that Jones has managed to escape the standing count here. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Judo: A medal assured, Indiaâ€™s Tulika Maan (second seed) will take on Scotlandâ€™s Sarah Adlington (top seed) in the women +78 kg final.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing, womenâ€™s 50kg QF: In action now is World Champion Nikhat Zareen against Helen Jones of Wales.  Can she assure India of a third medal in boxing and continue to sparkle in 2022?
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Dilip Unnikrishnan: Time for the final weightlifting event at the Birmingham Games and it is the menâ€™s 109+kg final. Indiaâ€™s Gurdeep Singh finished fourth at the 2018 Games and will be aiming to get on the podium this time around. Defending champion David Liti is the overwhelming favourite being the only lifter in todayâ€™s field to compete in Tokyo last year. Pakistanâ€™s Nooh Dastgir Butt won silver at last yearâ€™s Commonwealth Champions lifting one kilo more than bronze medal winner Gurdeep.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Smriti Mandhana out early. Shafali Verma run-out after a mixup. Harmanpreet Kaur LBW for a first-ball duck. This after India went in with just four pure batters. Cool cool cool cool.#CWG2022 #INDvBAR pic.twitter.com/13PKyKnAu1â€” Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 3, 2022



        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: Another massive setback for India! Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur is out LBW for a first-ball duck. Shakera Selman traps the right-hander in front.     Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: Big setback for India! Shafali Verma and Jemimah Rodrigues have a mixup for the former is run-out for 43 off 26. Shafali caught ball-watching there and she has to walk back distraught after playing a fine knock. The new batter is skipper Harmanpreet Kaur. India are 76/2 after 9 overs.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    â€œI donâ€™t know if this is my last one, maybe it is. Iâ€™ve done everything Iâ€™ve possibly could to be readyâ€ he told Shahid Judge. Itâ€™s the gold medal that he really wants but a historic first bronze in singles for the country is not bad for the 35-year-old who â€œlooks like a spring chickenâ€ according to the commentator a couple of days back.   Read more by Shahid Judge here.

    Cricket, India vs Barbados Group A: India have reached 50/1 at the end of the powerplay. Shafali Verma is going strong on 24 off 15, with Jemimah Rodrigues on 12 off 14.
